method.name: Iterative Dicotomizer 3

reference.ref: J.R. Quinlan. Induction of Decision trees. Machine Learning 1 (1986) 81-106.

generalDescription.objective: To determine a decision tree that on the basis of answers to questions about the input attributes predicts correctly the value of the target attribute.
generalDescription.howWork: ID3 is a decision tree generating algorithm that it induces classification rules in the form of decision trees from a set of given examples. The basic ideas behind ID3 are that: - In the decision tree each node corresponds to a non-categorical attribute and each arc to a possible value of that attribute. A leaf of the tree specifies the expected value of the categorical attribute for the records described by the path from the root to that leaf. - In the decision tree at each node should be associated the non-categorical attribute which is most informative among the attributes not yet considered in the path from the root. - Entropy is used to measure how informative is a node. - This is a binary version of ID3 where nodes are split by atributtes and values, instead of the generic ID3, which only considers attributes for splitting.
